data.enText: to succeed in dealing with or controlling a problem that has been preventing you from achieving sth

data.chText: 她战胜了伤痛，赢得了奥运会金牌。
data.enText: She overcame injury to win the Olympic gold medal.

data.chText: 两个政党设法弥合了在这个问题上的分歧。
data.enText: The two parties managed to overcome their differences on the issue.

data.chText: 在决赛中，瑞典队轻松战胜了法国队。
data.enText: In the final game Sweden easily overcame France.
to be extremely strongly affected by sth

data.chText: 在葬礼上她的父母悲痛欲绝。
data.enText: Her parents were overcome with grief at the funeral.

data.chText: 这个女人是被烟呛死的。
data.enText: The dead woman had been overcome by smoke.

simple_means.memory_skill: over 在…之上，凌驾 + come 来 → 来到〔困难〕上面 → 战胜

ex.chText: 他们肯定能打赢这场篮球赛。
ex.enText: They are sure to win this basketball match.

ex.chText: 那项发明为他赢得了一枚奖章。
ex.enText: That invention won him a medal.

ex.chText: 去年我们又获得了大丰收。
ex.enText: Last year we won another rich harvest.

synonyms.bx: 指在比赛、竞赛、选举、战争等中击败对手，成为胜利者。

ex.chText: 西班牙人于16世纪征服了新大陆。
ex.enText: The Spanish conquered the New World in the sixteenth century.

ex.chText: 科学家什么时候能征服恒星呢?
ex.enText: When will scientists conquer the stars?

ex.chText: 人类正在学会征服各种自然灾害。
ex.enText: Human beings are learning to conquer all kinds of natural disasters.

synonyms.bx: 含义广泛，既可指凭借武力或精神、道德方面的力量使对方屈服，又可指在排除阻力、障碍后取得胜利，强调不仅击败对方，而且还使对方臣服。

ex.chText: 政府军最终制服了反叛武装。
ex.enText: Government troops have finally overcome the rebel forces.

ex.chText: 第二语言学习者有许多障碍要克服
ex.enText: The learner of a second language has many obstacles to overcom

ex.chText: 她努力克服自己的羞怯。
ex.enText: She struggled to overcome her shyness.

synonyms.bx: 既可指在战斗、竞赛等中战胜对手，又可指在工作、学习等方面克服困难，也可指控制感情，克服某种不良心理。

ex.chText: 在这个问题上，谁也不能使对方折服。
ex.enText: It was an argument in which neither side could prevail over the other.

ex.chText: 主队最终以86比75击败了意大利队。
ex.enText: The host team eventually prevailed over the Italian team 86-75.

synonyms.bx: 指某人、某种观点或原则通过斗争、争辩等而获胜，常后接介词 over。

tr: overcome, usually through no fault or weakness of the person that is overcome
example: Heart disease can get the best of us
Her anger got the better of her and she blew up

tr: overcome, as with emotions or perceptual stimuli

value.boxr_value: The form overcome is used in the present tense and is also the past participle. overcome的过去分词与原形相同。

value.def: If you overcome a problem or a feeling, you successfully deal with it and control it.

example.ex: Molly had fought and overcome her fear of flying...
example.tran: 莫莉已经努力克服了对飞行的恐惧。

example.ex: Find a way to overcome your difficulties.

value.def: If you are overcome by a feeling or event, it is so strong or has such a strong effect that you cannot think clearly.

example.ex: The night before the test I was overcome by fear and despair...
example.tran: 考试前的晚上，恐惧和绝望让我内心无比惊慌。

example.ex: A dizziness overcame him, blurring his vision.
example.tran: 他感到一阵眩晕，眼前发黑。

value.tran: （感情上）受到极大影响，承受不起

value.def: If you are overcome by smoke or a poisonous gas, you become very ill or die from breathing it in.

example.ex: The residents were trying to escape from the fire but were overcome by smoke.
example.tran: 居民试图逃离火场，却被浓烟熏倒了。

partsOfSpeech.dec: over 过度，过分 + act 表演 → 表演过火
over 过度，过分 + burden 负担 → 使某人负担过重
over 过度，过分 + charge 收费 → 讨价过高
over 过度，过分 + confident 自信的 → 过于自信的
over 过度，过分 + cook 煮 + ed 已…的，被…的 → 煮得过久的
over 过度，过分 + correct 改正 → 矫枉过正
over 过度，过分 + crowded 拥挤的 → 挤满的
over 过度，过分 + dose 剂量 → 药物过量
over 过度，过分 + estimate 估计 → 高估
over 过度，过分 + pay 支付 → 多付款
over 过度，过分 + praise 赞扬 → 过度称赞
over 过度，过分 + production 生产 → 生产过剩
over 在…之上，凌驾 + bridge 桥 → 架在上面的桥 → 天桥
over 在…之上，凌驾 + coat 大衣 → 外套
over 在…之上，凌驾 + come 来 → 来到〔困难〕上面 → 战胜
over 在…之上，凌驾 + hang 悬挂 → 悬于…之上
over 在…之上，凌驾 + head 头 → 在头顶上
over 在…之上，凌驾 + hear 听 → 意料之外听到 → 无意中听到
over 在…之上，凌驾 + land 陆地 → 陆上
over 在…之上，凌驾 + lay 放 → 放在上面 → 覆盖
over 在…之上，凌驾 + leap 跳 → 越过
over 在…之上，凌驾 + lie 躺 → 躺在…上面
over 在…之上，凌驾 + look 看 → 在上面看 → 俯视
over 在…之上，凌驾 + power 力量 → 在力量上胜过 → 制服
over 在…之上，凌驾 + rule 统治 → 高高在上地统治 → 支配
over 在…之上，凌驾 + tone 音调 → 话语之上的意思 → 弦外之音
over 翻转 + haul 拉 → 拉翻过来检修 → 彻底检修
over 翻转 + set 放置 → 打翻；推翻
over 翻转 + throw 扔 → 扔翻 → 推翻
over 翻转 + turn 转 → 翻转 → 颠覆
